snippet: A wide trade gap can restrain growth because it means Americans are spending more on foreign goods than United States companies are gaining in overseas sales.
abstract: Commerce Department reports widening of trade deficit in April, as demand for foreign cars, cellphones and other imported goods outpaced growth in exports; trade gap rose 8.5 percent from March, to $40.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: A wide trade gap can restrain growth because it means Americans are spending more on foreign goods than United States companies are gaining in overseas sales.

headline.seo: Trade Deficit Widens 8.5% Despite Growth in Exports
headline.main: Trade Deficit Widens 8.5% Despite Growth in Exports
headline.print_headline: Trade Deficit Widens 8.5% Despite Growth in Exports
